summary: The Smoke Exposure Research Act (S. 1042) mandates the Agricultural Research Service to conduct research on the impact of wildfire smoke exposure on wine grapes. The research includes identifying smoke taint compounds, establishing testing methodologies, developing risk assessment tools, and studying potential barriers to protect grapes. The bill authorizes $6.5 million annually from 2026-2030 to fund this research, coordinating with land-grant colleges and universities in California, Oregon, and Washington.
